MemberSignature.Value: public Android.Views.View? GetChildView (int groupPosition, int childPosition, bool isLastChild, Android.Views.View? convertView, Android.Views.ViewGroup? parent);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.View GetChildView(int32 groupPosition, int32 childPosition, bool isLastChild, class Android.Views.View convertView, class Android.Views.ViewGroup parent) cil managed
Public Function GetChildView (groupPosition As Integer, childPosition As Integer, isLastChild As Boolean, convertView As View, parent As ViewGroup) As View
public: Android::Views::View ^ GetChildView(int groupPosition, int childPosition, bool isLastChild, Android::Views::View ^ convertView, Android::Views::ViewGroup ^ parent);
abstract member GetChildView : int * int * bool * Android.Views.View * Android.Views.ViewGroup -> Android.Views.View

Docs.param: the position of the group that contains the child
the position of the child (for which the View is returned) within the group
Whether the child is the last child within the group

the old view to reuse, if possible. You should check that this view is non-null and of an appropriate type before using. If it is not possible to convert this view to display the correct data, this method can create a new view. It is not guaranteed that the convertView will have been previously created by #getChildView(int, int, boolean, View, ViewGroup).
the parent that this view will eventually be attached to
Docs.summary: Gets a View that displays the data for the given child within the given group.
Docs.returns: the View corresponding to the child at the specified position
